meanings.definition: Teach (someone) new skills or ways of thinking.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will reeducate the students on how to solve math problems.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reeducate ourselves on the importance of recycling.
meanings.sent3: I tried to reeducate my cat on using the litter box, but he just won't listen.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reeducate her taste buds by trying new and exotic foods.
meanings.sent5: The workshop aims to reeducate participants on effective communication techniques.

meanings.sent1: The coach will reeducate the players on the proper technique for shooting a basketball.
meanings.sent2: After the mistake, the supervisor had to reeducate the employees on the company's policies.
meanings.sent3: I had to reeducate my alarm clock after the power outage messed up the time.
meanings.sent4: The museum's exhibit seeks to reeducate visitors on the history of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The parent decided to reeducate their child on the importance of honesty and integrity.
